TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed UITableViewCellStyle extends System.Enum

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype UIKit.UITableViewCellStyle Default = int64(0)

Docs.summary: Plain style with a black, left-aligned and an optional (that will appear to the left of the text).

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype UIKit.UITableViewCellStyle Subtitle = int64(3)

Docs.summary: Style with two text labels. They are both left-aligned, the top is large black text and the bottom uses smaller gray text. The Music app's Albums listing is an example of this cell style.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype UIKit.UITableViewCellStyle Value1 = int64(1)

Docs.summary: Style with two text labels. The appears on the left, and is left-aligned with black text. appears to the right, and is right-aligned with smaller blue text. The Settings app uses this style.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype UIKit.UITableViewCellStyle Value2 = int64(2)

Docs.summary: Style with two text labels. The appears on the left, but is right-aligned with blue text. appears to the right, but is left-aligned with black text. The detailed contact information in the Contacts app is an example of this cell style.
